alert.note: Alert for Pierce; Polk; St. Croix (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...URBAN AND SMALL STREAM FLOODING OCCURRING... Thunderstorms with heavy rain will cause minor flooding in the following counties... Hennepin...Dakota...Chisago...Scott...Anoka...Isanti...Washington... Ramsey...Pierce...St. Croix...Polk... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 856 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain and local urban flooding throughout the metro area. While the storms are moving out of the area, flooding may continue for the next 60 to 90 minutes. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen within 30 minutes. * Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Minneapolis, St. Paul, River Falls, Bloomington, Brooklyn Park, Plymouth, Eagan, Woodbury, Maple Grove, Coon Rapids, Eden Prairie and Burnsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.
